greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A336147(1+sigma(i)) = A336147(1+sigma(j)), for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the function f(n) = A336147(A088580(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); }; \\ From A046523
A122111(n) = if(1==n,n,my(f=factor(n), es=Vecrev(f[,2]),is=concat(apply(primepi,Vecrev(f[,1])),[0]),pri=0,m=1); for(i=1, #es, pri += es[i]; m *= prime(pri)^(is[i]-is[1+i])); (m));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 10 2020
